title: 'No concern for motherland': Centre slams Rahul on charges against India-US trade deal
content: Piyush Goyal refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims on the India-US trade deal, labeling them "baseless" and asserting that farmers' interests are fully protected. Rahul had alleged the agreement "betrays our food security and farmers," a charge ministers Goyal and Shivraj Singh Chouhan strongly denied, emphasising the deal's benefits for agricultural exports and farmer prosperity.

title: Bridge over troubled waters: Trump‚Äôs trade turbulence casts shadow on US-India Deal
content: US Congress is challenging President Trump's trade tariff powers, with a House vote against Canada tariffs and an impending Supreme Court ruling on emergency trade authority. This uncertainty, coupled with Trump's unpredictable demands, raises serious doubts about the stability of the new US-India trade framework, suggesting even signed deals might be temporary.

title: Centre rejects Sixth Schedule, statehood for Ladakh, offers council
content: Ladakh's major political groups, LAB and KDA, were informed by the Centre that neither Sixth Schedule status nor statehood will be granted. Instead, a 'territorial council' model was proposed, which leaders dismissed as a 'farce.'  Disagreements arose over the Sixth Schedule's effectiveness and Ladakh's financial viability for statehood.

title: Defence council clears 114 Rafale jets; mega deal set to be India‚Äôs biggest ever
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the acquisition of 114 Rafale fighter jets from France, a deal estimated at Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement, alongside other defence equipment, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's capabilities amidst rising threat perceptions. The majority of these multi-role fighters will be manufactured in India, enhancing indigenous defence production.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has equipped all 30,000 engineers with OpenAI's advanced AI coding tool, Codex, a significant enterprise rollout.  This move aligns with CEO Jensen Huang's vision to automate tasks, freeing engineers to focus on problem-solving.  Engineers are reportedly impressed with Codex's ability to maintain context during complex coding sessions, highlighting its efficiency and advanced capabilities.

title: Tamil Nadu: Cong pushes back at Stalin's 'friends without benefits' line
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore publicly challenged Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin's dismissal of power-sharing demands as a "conspiracy." Stalin firmly ruled out sharing governance with allies, asserting the DMK-Congress alliance remains intact. This public spat fuels speculation about the alliance's stability ahead of the 2026 elections.

title: 100 US lawmakers send letter to DHS Secretary Kristi Noem making an 'H-1B visa request'
content: One hundred US lawmakers have implored Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem to exempt the healthcare sector from a new $100,000 H-1B visa fee. They argue this fee will worsen critical staffing shortages, particularly in rural and underserved areas, jeopardizing access to care for millions. The lawmakers stressed that domestic workforce alone cannot fill these vital roles.

title: How India's IT sector is 'uniquely positioned' to weather Trump's visa, immigration storm
content: Moody‚Äôs is of the view that most of these IT sector firms will be able to absorb the higher visa costs without a significant deterioration in their operating or financial profiles. India is in a unique position to bridge the talent gap that the US is facing. Moody‚Äôs explains that the US is set to face increasing labour shortages because of declining birthrates and a population that is fast aging.

title: Elon Musk gives less than a year to coding as a profession
content: Elon Musk predicts coding as we know it will cease to exist by year-end, with AI directly generating optimized machine code. This could eliminate traditional software development steps. Meanwhile, SpaceX is prioritizing a Moon city over its Mars mission, aiming for lunar habitation within a decade, though Mars remains a long-term goal.

title: Muslim groups, Left, TMC oppose govt‚Äôs move to mandate recitation of all 6 verses of Vande Mataram
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board and Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind have strongly objected to the government's notification mandating the recitation of all six verses of 'Vande Mataram'. They deem the order unconstitutional and a violation of religious freedom, threatening legal challenges. Left parties and Trinamool Congress also oppose the move, citing constitutional provisions and the secular character of the nation.

title: Olympian Chloe Kim playfully scolds Myles Garrett at 2026 Games
content: Myles Garrett and Olympian Chloe Kim have quickly turned into fan favorites as they flaunt their love and commitment towards one another. As Chloe Kim chases another win at the 2026 Winter Olympics, she shared a heartfelt moment she shared with her boyfriend, the Cleveland Browns' star player, Myles Garrett. This post also comes at a time when Chloe Kim has admitted her fears of being in a public relationship.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan as Connor McDavid eyes opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle‚Äôs Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year‚Äôs international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bad Bunny, Kendall Jenner spark buzz after Super Bowl LX show
content: Supermodel and Bad Bunny's ex girlfriend, Kendall Jenner, was spotted at Super Bowl LX as the popular Grammy winner took the stage for his controversial record breaking performance at the halftime show. Soon after the show, rumors of the two rekindling their romance have sparked chaos. Amid this, a clip of two leaving in his luxurious car has sparked panic as many believe the two have got back together.

title: Kayla Nicole breaks silence with cryptic message after Swift-Kelce digs
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce might have a lot to deal with in their lives but the star player's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, has continued to brutally shade the billionaire pop star. Kayla Nicole's recent comments have sparked chaos and now the popular social media influencer has dropped a cryptic message about her mental state as many continue to shame her.

title: No irregularities in 133 luxury vehicles‚Äô purchase, claims J&K govt
content: Jammu & Kashmir's transport minister has refuted claims of irregularities in the procurement of 133 luxury vehicles for FY 24-25. He stated purchases by departments and PSUs adhered strictly to norms, denying any extra burden on public funds. While admitting some norm relaxations for challenging terrains and operational needs, the minister maintained no deviations occurred.

title: 'Incorrect & speculative': AAIB pans Italian report blaming pilot for AI171 crash
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) has clarified that the investigation into the June 2025 Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad is ongoing, refuting reports of conclusions that balmed the pilot for the incident. The AAIB emphasized that investigations are technical and evidence-based, with the final report to be published upon completion, dismissing speculative foreign media claims.

title: No plan to set up women‚Äôs panel as NCW has J&K cell: Omar govt
content: Jammu and Kashmir government informed the assembly it has no plans for a separate women's commission, citing the National Commission for Women's dedicated "J&K and Ladakh Cell." This decision drew criticism from Sajad Lone, who questioned the delay in reconstituting the commission, a move approved in 2022.  Over 5,000 cases were pending when the previous commission was dissolved.

title: Hardik Pandya's Army-style camp: The secret behind his explosive T20 form
content: India secured a dominant 93-run victory over Namibia in the T20 World Cup. Ishan Kishan and Hardik Pandya scored aggressive half-centuries, propelling India to 209/9. Namibia was bowled out for 116. Pandya expressed satisfaction with his form and preparation. India's next match is against Pakistan.

title: Chinnaswamy reopens for cricket, RCB to host IPL matches
content: The Karnataka cabinet approved the return of cricket to Bengaluru‚Äôs M Chinnaswamy Stadium, clearing RCB to host IPL matches again after a ban following the 2025 stampede that killed 11 people. The decision follows safety upgrades and committee recommendations, with detailed conditions to be issued soon. Short-term safety measures must be completed by March 15 ahead of the IPL season starting March 26.

title: India crush Namibia by 93 runs in Delhi; register biggest victory by runs in T20 World Cup
content: India secured a dominant 93-run victory over Namibia in the T20 World Cup. This marks India's second consecutive win. Ishan Kishan and Hardik Pandya starred with half-centuries, propelling India to 209. Namibia was bowled out for 116. India's next match is against Pakistan.

title: 'File case, do what you want': Rahul reiterates Trump pressure on PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi said the Modi government's decision to import American "corn, soybeans, and fruits" is just a beginning and that the Centre would "open the doors of the entire agriculture market‚Äã‚Äã for his friends, for people like Adani and Ambani, and for foreign powers." He reiterated his "PM Modi has sold the nation" remark.

title: H-1B visa row: How employers are adapting & what it means for aspirants
content: The upcoming H-1B season for FY 2027 presents unprecedented uncertainty for Indian professionals and US employers. A new wage-weighted selection system, a proposed $100,000 entry fee, and severe consular backlogs in India are forcing companies to rethink hiring strategies, potentially shifting focus to candidates already in the US.

title: Refilled aerated drinks at T20 World Cup venue? DDCA issues statement
content: The DDCA has refuted claims of unhygienic practices concerning soft drinks at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.  Responding to a viral video, the association stated the vendor's action was part of waste segregation and disposal procedures by an authorized concessionaire, adhering to environmental and operational guidelines. Strict hygiene protocols are reportedly maintained at the venue.

title: China tightens hold on rare earth metals to counter US supply chain push
content: China is intensifying its focus on rare earth metals, with Premier Li Qiang visiting a major production base to underscore its strategic importance. This comes as the US builds an international coalition to secure critical mineral supply chains, launching a $12 billion "Project Vault" to reduce reliance on China's dominant position.

title: B'desh elections: Hasina labels polls a farce, demands 'fresh vote'; targets Yunus
content: Bangladesh's Awami League has denounced the recent parliamentary election as a staged charade, asserting it violated democratic principles and the constitution. The party claims widespread voter apathy, intimidation, and ballot stuffing marred the process. They are demanding the election's annulment, the chief advisor's resignation, and fresh polls under a neutral government to reinstate citizens' voting rights.

title: Ishan Kishan becomes first Indian keeper to accomplish this T20 WC record
content: Ishan Kishan made history by becoming the first Indian wicketkeeper to score a fifty in a T20 World Cup, blasting 61 off 24 balls against Namibia at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. His knock helped India post 209/9, with Hardik Pandya adding 52 and useful contributions from Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma and Shivam Dube.

title: From braille to bench: Thanya Nathan to become Kerala‚Äôs first visually impaired judge
content: Thanya Nathan, a trailblazing law graduate with visual impairment, has shattered barriers by emerging as the top candidate in Kerala's Civil Judge (Junior Division) exam for the disabled category. Drawing motivation from a pivotal Supreme Court ruling, she effectively harnessed assistive technologies and Braille in her studies.

title: Aditya Pancholi moves Bombay HC to quash rape FIR, court issues notice
content: The Bombay High Court on Thursday heard a petition filed by Bollywood actor Aditya Pancholi seeking quashing of a rape FIR registered against him in 2019 at Mumbai‚Äôs Versova police station.

title: Dead-ball drama! Umpire intervenes, bowler forced to re-bowl in India vs Namibia match
content: A bizarre delivery from Namibia's captain Gerhard Erasmus during their T20 World Cup clash against India in Delhi caused a stir, leading to a dead ball call and a disagreement with the umpire. India, bolstered by the return of Sanju Samson and Jasprit Bumrah, aimed to defend their total after winning the toss.

title: Record! Italy batters become first-ever pair to achieve this feat
content: Italy made history at the T20 World Cup as brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca powered them to their first-ever World Cup win with a 10-wicket thrashing of Nepal. After restricting Nepal to 123, the duo chased it with an unbeaten 124-run opening stand, setting a record for the highest sibling partnership in T20 World Cup history.

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi snaps at reporters outside Parliament; Rijiju questions his stance
content: A political storm brewed in Parliament as Rahul Gandhi confronted journalists over privilege motion queries, sparking BJP criticism. This follows his strong Lok Sabha attack on the government. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju accused Gandhi of avoiding questions and shared a video of alleged misconduct in the Speaker's chamber, which Priyanka Gandhi Vadra denied.

title: Will BTS take over from Bad Bunny? Inside the Super Bowl 2027 halftime race
content: Bad Bunny just turned Super Bowl LX into a global Spanish-language flex. Now Super Bowl LXI heads to SoFi Stadium on Feb. 14, 2027, and the NFL has a problem: who can possibly top that? From BTS and a full K-Pop spectacle to Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber and Jay-Z, here is the real early shortlist.

title: 'Neither my language nor my voice': Tharoor flags fake AI video claiming he praised Pakistan
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has slammed a fabricated AI-generated video falsely attributing praise for Pakistan's diplomatic handling of a T20 World Cup boycott to him. Tharoor clarified the video was fake, stating neither the language nor voice was his, and had previously called Pakistan's boycott "disgraceful."

title: T20 World Cup: Sanju Samson trolled online after Namibia show - 'One more chance wasted'
content: Sanju Samson was trolled on social media after scoring 22 off 8 balls against Namibia in the T20 World Cup, with fans saying he wasted another chance. He played in place of Abhishek Sharma, who was ill. Namibia chose to bowl on a flat pitch, while Suryakumar Yadav spoke about dew and team changes. Despite criticism, India started strongly, but Samson‚Äôs dismissal reignited consistency debates.

title: 'Negotiations under way': Rajpal Yadav has paid half amount of debt, says his lawyer
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav's lawyer reports that half of the outstanding amount in his insolvency case has been cleared. A bail application requires a response from the opposing party, with further instructions to be sought from Yadav in jail.  Negotiations continue on a 2012 agreement, with clearer answers expected Monday.

title: Tendulkar celebrates Italy's win - 'Proud footballing nation making mark'
content: Sachin Tendulkar praised Italy‚Äôs historic first T20 World Cup win, calling it a proud moment for a footballing nation embracing cricket. Italy thrashed Nepal by 10 wickets at Wankhede, with spinners Kalugamage and Manenti restricting Nepal to 123 before Mosca brothers chased easily. Stand-in captain Harry Manenti called it a dream moment, while Nepal skipper Rohit Paudel credited Italy for their strong performance.

title: 1897 dinner menu reveals lavish feast hosted by Baroda royal for Gwalior Maharaja
content: A 1897 dinner menu from the Maharaja of Baroda to the Maharaja of Gwalior, discovered by historian Neha Vermani, reveals a fascinating blend of Indian royalty and European fine dining. Featuring French dishes like truffles and partridge alongside a vegetable curry, the menu highlights the sophisticated tastes and global influences of Indian elites, sparking widespread social media interest.

title: You spin me right round: Comet 41P's odd rotation stump astronomers
content: A rare event was observed as comet 41P/Tuttle-Giacobini-Kres√°k dramatically slowed its rotation and then spun in the opposite direction. This extreme change in spin, driven by material jets, was captured by Hubble and Swift telescopes. Astronomers believe this process may explain the rarity of smaller comets.

title: Mega Rs 3.6L cr defence boost: Govt gives nod for 114 Rafale jets, missiles & P-8I aircraft
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of Rafale fighter jets from France for an estimated Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement will see 80% of the jets manufactured in India, bolstering the Indian Air Force's fleet and addressing rising regional security concerns.

title: Happy Valentines Day 2026: Wishes, messages, quotes to share with your special someone
content: Valentine's Day, celebrated annually on February 14th, honours all forms of love, from romantic sparks to friendship cheers. In 2026, it falls on a Saturday, offering a perfect opportunity for connection.  Tracing its roots to ancient Roman festivals and medieval legends, the day has evolved into a global celebration of affection and appreciation.

title: Source: Patriots to move DC Williams to new role
content: The Patriots are opening their defensive coordinator position by moving Terrell Williams to a high-ranking role on coach Mike Vrabel's staff, a source confirmed.

title: U.S. men's hockey dominates Latvia in opener
content: The U.S. opened Olympic play by rolling past Latvia on Thursday night in a showcase of some of the country's best NHL players.

title: Kim falls short in bid to win third straight gold
content: Chloe Kim fell short in her bid to become the first Olympic snowboarder to win three consecutive gold medals, finishing second to Choi Gaon of South Korea in the women's halfpipe.

title: UNC star Wilson out with fractured left hand
content: North Carolina star Caleb Wilson, a projected top-five pick in the 2026 NBA draft, is out with no timetable for return after he suffered a fractured left hand in his team's 75-66 loss at Miami on Tuesday.

title: Castellanos released, admits to beer in dugout
content: The Philadelphia Phillies have released outfielder Nick Castellanos, making him a free agent who can sign with any club for the league minimum.

title: Agent: Sochan joining Knicks after Spurs release
content: Free agent forward Jeremy Sochan, who was released by the Spurs, plans to sign with the Knicks after he clears waivers, his agent told ESPN.

title: OKC to review Williams' injury after All-Star break
content: Thunder forward Jalen Williams will be reevaluated after the All-Star break after again straining his right hamstring, a team spokesperson told ESPN.

title: Freshman OF ID'd as victim in bus crash in Iowa
content: Carter Johnson, a 19-year-old member of the Iowa Lakes Community College baseball team, was identified Thursday as the victim in a bus crash that injured 32 others a day earlier, police said.

content: The ACC and the Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

content: Our experts break down what to watch over the 2026 NBA All-Star Weekend and their picks for contests, competitions and more.

content: Three past MVP QBs -- Rich Gannon, Matt Ryan and Kurt Warner -- weighed in on the issues that impacted Jackson's tumultuous season.

title: Which teams can turn it around fast? Tiering the 18 non-playoff teams' rebuild timelines
content: Can the Ravens and Chiefs get back on top? How about the Cowboys? We stacked teams that missed the playoffs.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts, earned the pole Wednesday with a lap at 183.925 mph.

content: With a few years of experience at college, which top recruits delivered, who didn't and which were pleasant surprises?

title: 11 experts predict the 2026 NFL season: Early Super Bowl picks, MVP favorites and more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: Salford City hoping their rebrand, FA Cup run can help club's push for global recognition
content: With Man United legends Gary Neville and David Beckham leading the charge, Salford City are hoping to become 'the best small club in the world' by 2030. An FA Cup tie at Man City this weekend won't hurt either.

title: 'I would have gone higher': 'Selling Sunset' star pays $575K for SB jersey and ring
content: Jason Oppenheim paid $470,000 for the game-worn jersey of Washington Hall of Famer John Riggins in Super Bowl XVII.

title: American skier Breezy Johnson gets engaged in Italy after competing
content: The downhill champion didn't medal in the super-G on Thursday -- but she did leave with an engagement ring.

title: What's the fantasy baseball impact of 'new homes' for Rays, Royals?
content: Todd Zola breaks down what makes MLB stadiums favor pitching versus hitting, as well as the impact of new stadiums/dimensions being used in 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool monitoring USMNT's Christian Pulisic
content: Liverpool are keeping tabs on United States star Christian Pulisic, whose contract at AC Milan has less than 18 months remaining. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Burning questions: How will the heavyweight division shake out in 2026?
content: With a stable of established veterans and plenty of rising talent at heavyweight, the landscape could be much different by the end of the year.

content: Legislator R.S. Pathania demanded a dedicated Media Monitoring Cell¬†in the DIPR for real-time tracking of fake news

content: Ranjana Jha, his alleged first wife, said that she had also filed cases in the Family Court in Supaul and approached the Women‚Äôs Commission

content: The lecture is being organised by the Dr. Manmohan Singh Trust and former German Chancellor Merkel will speak on ‚ÄúGermany and India in times of global change‚Äù

content: The High Court also ordered placing of Inquiry Committee with regards to missing key on the floor of Assembly House in the ensuing session

content: This data is for those who have been questioning us over the conversion of MoUs, the Chief Minister says at the Conversion Conclave 2026 in Chennai. Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa highlights the government‚Äôs achievements in a presentation

title: FOMRRA submits people‚Äôs manifesto to political parties
content: The manifesto outlines critical demands, including improved drainage systems, 24/7 potable water access, establishing a multi-specialty hospital and fire stations, among other demands

title: Giving 2.20 lakh digital title deeds in unrecognised habitations in two years is a record for Karnataka, says Revenue Minister
content: As the government is gearing up to provide digital title deeds for properties of over 1.1 lakh families in unrecognised habitations in Karnataka, on February 14 in Haveri, it is set to create a record of sorts

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to set up Municipal Trust Property Management System to protect public properties
content: Pointing out that public properties controlled by various municipalities are not maintained and protected as mandated by law, the High Court of Karnataka directed the State government to set up and operationalise a Municipal Trust Property Management System, as a single source of truth for all such properties across the State and assign a Trust Property Identification Number

title: SIT starts fresh sample collection in gold theft probe at Sabarimala
content: SIT, assisted by personnel from the Legal Metrology department, forensic laboratory, and skilled artisans, began removing gold-plated covering from artefacts in the sanctum sanctorum¬†and its pillars on Thursday evening

title: Fire breaks out in building in Naval Dockyard in south Mumbai
content: An official said the spot where the fire erupted was situated diagonally opposite the Gateway of India in Colaba

title: Racing activities of Bangalore Turf Club to move to Kunigal Stud Farm
content: The existing turf club in the heart of Bengaluru will be turned into a lung space; BTC will be given two years to move to the Stud Farm

title: Left parties, trade unions vow to fight against Centre‚Äôs ‚Äòanti-worker‚Äô policies
content: They demand that the Central government repeal the four Labour Codes, fix a minimum wage of ‚Çπ30,000, and strictly implement labour laws

title: Expert calls for chemical processes to promote resource efficiency
content: Participants of conference on ‚ÄòEco-Adaptive Research for Techno-Sustainable Harmony‚Äô stress the need for developing recyclable and biodegradable materials to support circular economy model

title: Union Minister lauds State‚Äôs education reforms at AI Conclave in Delhi
content: Dharmendra Pradhan visits the special stall set up by the Andhra Pradesh School Education Department

content: The commission also directed that the work of the health squad deployed at night be intensified and that police officers be provided to assist them

title: Tangkhul Hui and Kombai breeds to add bite to the dog squad of Assam Rifles
content: India‚Äôs oldest paramilitary force plans to phase out foreign breeds by 2050 as a part of the Centre‚Äôs push for indigenous guard and tracker dogs

content: Why are suppliers indemnified? What does the Act change in the CLNDA? Does capping liability create moral hazard? How much of India‚Äôs electricity comes from nuclear energy? Why have past nuclear capacity targets been missed?

content: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind president Arshad Madani called it ‚Äúa blatant attack on religious freedom‚Äù of the minorities

title: Congress demands Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri‚Äôs resignation
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera asks why he organised a visit for LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman when there is a full-fledged Indian Embassy

title: Supreme Court underscores Tamil Nadu‚Äôs  due representation on UPSC committee  set to recommend regular police chief
content: The court agrees with Tamil Nadu‚Äôs contention that the slot of DGP on the UPSC empanelment committee should not remain vacant merely because the acting DGP is also a candidate in the zone of consideration

title: Nationwide strike draws 30 crore participants, say trade unions
content: The strike call, issued jointly by the central trade unions and the Samyukt Kisan Morcha, was to protest against the recent slew of FTAs, Labour Codes; strike actions reported from 600 districts, unions say

title: Now, airlines oppose relaxed duty norms for cabin crew
content: Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA), in a letter to DGCA, opposes expansion of definition of night duty from midnight‚Äì5 a.m. to midnight‚Äì6 a.m., scheduling of weekly off at crew members‚Äô home base, and calls for single-room accommodation during layovers instead of shared rooms.

title: Cabinet nod for Shakti scheme smart cards to streamline zero ticket system
content: Introduced on June 11, 2023, as the first of the Congress government‚Äôs five guarantees, the Shakti Scheme allows women, including transgender persons and students, to travel free of cost on non-premium State-run buses

title: Did Sonam Wangchuk see videos cited as proof for detention under NSA, Supreme Court asks Govt.
content: Additional Solicitor General K.M. Nataraj told the top court that the authorities banked on 23 videos to order the detention of Sonam Wangchuk, and everything was supplied to the activist

title: Kerala disillusioned with LDF, UDF, looking to BJP-NDA with great hope: Modi
content: The PM says the party‚Äôs elected representatives are committed to working at the grassroots to address the people‚Äôs challenges in the State

title: In the age of AI, governing decisions matters more than governing infra, say experts
content: They argue that as AI systems influence real-time decisions across sectors, traditional governance, risk, and compliance models are yet to catch up, exposing organisations to new and poorly understood risks

title: MEA refuses to deny U.S. claims on India‚Äôs Russian oil imports
content: Senior U.S. official reiterates that India has reduced Russian oil purchases as U.S. ‚Äúwanted‚Äù, is buying more American energy; joint statement, with no mention of Russian oil, is the ‚Äúframework‚Äù on this matter, says MEA

title: Forest fire breaks out in Palode
content: Preliminary reports indicate that nearly 10 acres of forest land have been destroyed in the fire which is reported to have originated in the Chekkonam forest region

content: Police strengthen vigil in the area; SP MP Afzal Ansari demands Supreme Court to take suo motu cognisance of the incident, which impacts communal harmony

content: Mr. Venugopal linked the development to what the Leader of Opposition had said in the Lok Sabha during the Budget discussion on Wednesday (February 11, 2026), much of which has been expunged

content: Doctors to stage protests at district medical offices across the State on February 13, 2026, and submit a memorandum

content: Bodhan AI will build an open-source ‚ÄòBharat EduAI Stack‚Äô to introduce Artificial Intelligence applications across all levels of education, from kindergarten to research

content: The Maharashtra-based manufacturing unit of Heritage Foods had supplied 16.50 lakh kg of ghee at the rate of ‚Çπ306 per kg in 2015, alleges YSRCP leader Bhumana Karunakar Reddy

content: The WHO is working with¬†India and Bangladesh for risk assessment, follow-up of contacts, and community engagement¬†

title: No conclusions reached yet in ongoing AI-171 crash probe, says investigation body
content: The statement comes in response to an Italian newspaper‚Äôs claim that Indian investigators may conclude the crash was caused by a pilot

title: Debate over land allocation at ‚Çπ0.99 per acre to companies rocks A.P. Council
content: Refuting corruption allegations levelled by YSRCP members, IT Minister Lokesh says that incentives are essential to compete with other States in attracting investments

title: Railway Minister promises to consider more stops for  trains between Chingavanam and Ernakulam
content: Assurance given during a meeting in which the Kottayam MP directly discussed various railway-related issues with the Railway Minister

title: General strike paralyses life in Kollam
content: Despite widespread shutdown, organisers provided essential breathing room for personal and spiritual events as vehicles used for religious ceremonies, festivals, and weddings were strictly exempted from the strike

title: Govt. launches ‚ÄòHappy Sunday‚Äô to foster neighbourhood bonds
content: The initiative seeks to enhance emotional well-being, encourage physically active lifestyles, and foster social cohesion by activating public spaces such as streets and parks for community interaction

title: 35 years after he entered India and raised a family, Bangladeshi man jailed in Odisha
content: Abu Sahik was picked up by the police from Bhubaneswar in September 2025; denied bail twice, his counsels argue that the law does not discriminate between a foreigner and an Indian in granting of bail

title: Rolls Royce says eyeing tenfold rise in India sourcing
content: The company is currently exploring opportunities in India that include the potential co-development of a next-generation combat jet engine, as well as partnerships to localise and manufacture engines for the Indian Army, Navy and Coast Guard and potentially power solutions for critical infrastructure and industry

title: Nationwide general strike nearly complete in¬†Ernakulam
content: Public transport remained entirely off the roads. Shops, establishments, and schools stayed closed, while attendance in offices was severely affected. Hotels and eateries were also largely shut

title: Nishagandhi Puraskaram for Manipuri dancer Darshana Jhaveri
content: The honour will be conferred on the dancer at the inaugural ceremony of the week-long Nishagandhi Dance Festival organised by Kerala Tourism on February 13

title: Mamata Banerjee calls migrant worker‚Äôs death in Pune an outcome of¬†‚Äòhate crime‚Äô
content: There has been a spike in attacks on migrant workers from West Bengal in several States across the country and Trinamool Congress has linked the attacks with Bengali language and identity

title: National strike near-total in Thrissur
content: Minor tension reported in a few areas where strike supporters allegedly compelled establishments to shut down. Devotees arriving at the Sreekrishna temple were left stranded due to the absence of bus services

title: 'Serious lapses by cops': Why Lambo crash accused Shivam Mishra got bail within hours
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: British Indians have continually helped British economy prosper since WWII: Report
content: paper titled ‚ÄúMigration of the Indian Diaspora to the UK‚Äù explores four waves of migrants from the 1940s post-war reconstruction to the post-2019 post-Brexit influx . it recommends the UK adopt a smarter migration strategy to align visa routes with employer demand, mutual qualification recognition with India .

title: Ladakh returned to normalcy after Sonam Wangchuk detention, govt tells SC
content: agitation and violence in ladakh came under control after sonam Wangchuk's detention . he was the chief provocateur that led to the violence in which four people were killed . the detention order was a perfect order, which was justified in the situation, the solicitor general says .

title: Potholes killed 9,438 from 2020 to 2024: Govt
content: more than half a dozen states and UTs reported "zero" road crashes, injuries, or deaths . the overall number of fatalities has consistently increased from 1,555 in 2020 to 2,385 in 2024 . govt data shows the total number of pothole-related deaths has increased by 53% .

title: Cong's 'solo' gamble in West Bengal: Why decision to dump Left may be right
content: the Congress announced to go solo in all 294 seats in the upcoming assembly elections . in the 2021 assembly elections, the Congress could not win even one seat in the 294-member assembly . the party has broken its alliance with the left to take on the common enemy - the ruling Trinamool Congress and its leader Mamata Banerjee .

title: Deepen ties with masses, PM Modi tells Kerala BJP
content: a pep talk to party members recently elected to the state's local bodies . he said voters are fed up with the ruling LDF and main opposition UDF . the party's performance in the state, including its maiden mayoral win, historic .

title: Defence ministry inks Rs 2,312-crore deal with HAL for 8 Dornier aircraft for Coast Guard
content: defence ministry inked a Rs 2,312 crore contract with defence PSU Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) for production of eight Dornier 228 Aircraft for the Indian Coast Guard . the contract was signed under the ‚Äúbuy (Indian) category‚Äù in the presence of defence secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate a team's underlying potential .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Chloe Kim falls short of snowboarding history and more
content: American snowboarder Chloe Kim fell just short of history at the Winter Olympics on Thursday. Kim, who was trying to become the first snowboarder to win three straight Olympic gold medals with a win in the women's halfpipe final, looked to be well on track after an 88.00 in her first run. A fall in her second run left her vulnerable, however, and 17-year-old South Korean Choi Ga-on took advantage, scoring a 90.25 in her third run. Kim was unable to overcome that deficit, falling in her third run. The preliminary round for men's ice hockey began with the U.S. and Canada among countries in action. The U.S. team hasn't won gold in men's Olympic hockey since 1980, but this year it's gold medal or bust. "That's the expectation," captain Auston Matthews  said . Both the U.S. and Canada got started on the right foot in their openers, winning 5-1 and 5-0, respectively. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Below are all the top moments from Thursday's events.

title: Power Rankings: Same top 4, different order -- including No. 1
content: the top seven teams in last week's Power Rankings went 8-7 in the span of seven days, with Michigan accounting for three of those wins . all four of those teams lost: UConn to St. John's at Madison Square Garden on Friday; Duke at the buzzer to North Carolina on Saturday; Illinois in overtime to Michigan State on Sunday; and Arizona at Kansas . the carnage extended down the rankings more than expected .

title: Opening game onslaught: Grades, top players, key questions from Team USA's win over Latvia
content: team USA has won its opening game in the 2026 men's ice hockey tournament . it upended Latvia by a final score of 5-1 . there's going to be certain players every team must rely upon if they're going to win .

title: Premier League's 50 worst transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: the richest clubs in the premier league have sometimes been able to overcome some poor decisions in the transfer market . some of the best teams in league history have been built around exactly that . a man's injury history began after he made a big-money move .

title: Trump Ends Immigration Crackdown In Minnesota
content: President Donald Trump's pointman on Thursday announced the end of an aggressive immigration operation in Minnesota that triggered large protests and nationwide outrage following the killing of two US citizens.

title: What Is Going On With Iran-US Talks?
content: Iran and the US have yet to set a date for a new round of talks after an initial encounter last week on the contested Iranian nuclear programme but, for now, US President Trump is not rushing to launch military action against the Islamic republic.

title: Trump Warns Iran Of "Very Traumatic" Outcome If No Nuclear Deal
content: US President Donald Trump threatened Iran Thursday with "very traumatic" consequences if it fails to make a nuclear deal -- but Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he was skeptical about the quality of any such agreement.

title: Bangladesh TV Channels Show BNP Leading As Vote Counting Continues
content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party crossed the halfway mark to win the parliamentary election on Friday, a local TV station showed, as ballots were counted in a pivotal vote that is expected to restore political stability.

title: In 'Atmnirbhar' Push, Assam Rifles To Induct Indian Dog Breeds In Its Squad
content: Giving a fillip to the central government's call for indigenisation, Assam Rifles is planning to induct dog breeds available in India into its squad for carrying out a range of operations, a senior official said on Thursday.

title: 'Have you filed this for media publicity?': SC refuses to entertain Jairam Ramesh plea on ex‚Äëpost facto clearances
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to entertain a writ petition filed by Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Jairam Ramesh challenging the grant of ex-post facto environmental clearances (EC).

title: 2,661 Indian Fishermen Repatriated From Pakistan Since 2014: Centre
content: Due to sustained efforts by the Centre, 2,661 Indian fishermen have been repatriated from Pakistan since 2014, the government informed the Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

title: Woman Kills Mother In Her Sleep After Astrologer's "Black Magic" Claims
content: A 33-year-old woman allegedly murdered her mother after an astrologer convinced her that the older woman had used black magic to kill her father.

title: Lodha Developers' Ex-Director Arrested In Rs 85-Crore Money Laundering Case
content: Rajendra Lodha, former director of the Lodha Developers Limited, was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on Thursday in connection with an alleged Rs 85-crore money laundering case linked to suspected fraudulent land and financial transactions.

title: India Textiles To Get US Benefits Like Bangladesh, Official Says
content: India's textile exports to the US will receive the same benefits Washington has extended to Bangladesh, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Thursday.

title: After Wife's Miscarriage, Man Beheads Neighbours To 'Please Angry Deity'
content: A 21-year-old man allegedly beheaded two of his neighbours with a sharp weapon during a religious ritual in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli district early Thursday morning.

title: Tarique Rahman's BNP Leads In Early Trends, Jamaat Faces Setback
content: The election and referendum in Bangladesh saw over 55% voter turnout despite the Awami League missing from the electoral process. Some Awami League voters may have stayed away from the voting process, a study of the voter turnout suggests.

title: Gaurav Gogoi Restrained By Court From Speaking On Himanta Sarma's Property
content: A Guwahati court has issued an interim stay order restraining seven accused individual from making any statements or remarks concerning the Chief Minister or the assets of his family until the next hearing.

title: Chhattisgarh Cops Left Red Faced As Constable Arrested While Trying To Sell Heroin
content: The Chhattisgarh Police are once again under intense scrutiny after a serving police constable was arrested for allegedly attempting to sell banned heroin in the state capital.

title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Early Counting Shows BNP Ahead Of Jamaat In Elections
content: Bangladesh Election 2026 Voting Live Updates: Bangladeshi is voting today in a crucial national election, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: With Ajit Pawar's Death, Merger Of Two Factions Of NCP Appears To Be On Hold
content: The strong buzz about the merger of the two factions of the Nationalist Congress Party that had peaked ahead of Maharashtra's civic elections, has dropped just as quickly after the death of Ajit Pawar.

title: YouTuber Fails To Get Followers, Sets Rs 10 Lakh Studio On Fire
content: A 27-year-old YouTuber in Jharkhand's Garhwa district set fire to his home studio on Saturday night. While the police and neighbours managed to rescue his family, equipment and property worth over Rs 10 lakh were destroyed.

title: Students Made To Travel In Goods Vehicles For School Trip In Karnataka, Headmaster Suspended
content: In a disturbing incident reported from Karnataka's Balanje village, schoolchildren were allegedly transported in an open pickup truck and a tipper for a study tour on Monday, triggering outrage among parents and locals.

title: "AI Reshaping Jobs. It Needs Rules, Not Panic": Top UN Technology Envoy To NDTV
content: Dr Amandeep Singh Gill described AI as one of the most powerful general-purpose technologies humanity has ever created.

title: Power Rankings: A big week for the top of the Big 12
content: eight new members since 2023 and the departure of league powers Texas and Oklahoma to the SEC in 2024 . the Bears sit atop the Big 12 standings at 10-2 and are seeking their first regular season title since last winning its 12th consecutive crown in 2022 .

title: Points league rankings: Cooper Flagg, Cade Cunningham on the rise
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . he burst up almost 30 spots this update on the strength of his four-game span last week . the mavericks have leaned into their rebuild by trading Anthony Davis .
